title: What is the use of information technology in healthcare? - Quora

response.answer_text: Several of my clients are healthcare providers (hospitals, clinics), health insurance companies, or pharmacies. “Information Technology” is a huge field. It is also one of the underlying technologies in healthcare today. I.T. touches everything like: Computers Doctors and Nurses use for research.Billing (patient, hospital supplies, pharmacy)Patient medical recordsServers to store informationInventory tracking and ordering systemsMedical Test ordersSecurity (badge readers are networked)TelecommunicationsNetwork connectivity between all those systems…etc.It basically allows hospitals, insurance companies and pharmacies to do business in this modern world.

Information Technology (IT) has the potential to improve the quality, safety, and efficiency of healthcare. This paper focuses on the expanding role of IT in Healthcare Information. Communication technologies had a significant impact on healthcare and the delivery of health services. From Telemedicine to electronic health records ,a variety of healthcare services have been shown to improve operational and administrative efficiencies, clinical outcomes, documentation and information flow in a global settings, home care units, rural health centers and large urban hospitals. Health Information Technology (Health IT) is a broad term that describes the technology and infrastructure used to record, analyze, and share patient health data. Various technologies include health record systems, including personal, paper, and electronic; personal health tools including smart devices and apps; and finally, communities to share and discuss information. The benefits of health information technology (IT) include its ability to store and retrieve data; the ability to rapidly communicate patient information in a legible format; improved medication safety through increased legibility, which potentially decreases the risk of medication errors; and the ease of retrieval of patient information. Health IT is increasing patient engagement as consumers of health care. It allows patients access to their medical records, which helps them to feel more knowledgeable about their conditions and encourages them to actively participate in shared decision making.
